Students' struggle goes on in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The 7th-term inaugural ceremony of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) was held at Kyunghee University in Seoul on may 29 despite the cordon thrown by more than 4,200 strong  police force of 41 companies,  according to a radio report from Seoul. The ceremony adopted a declaration "Let us struggle in solidarity with people from all walks of life to overthrow the U.S. imperialists and the fascist 'government'".   
   Hanchongryon held a press conference at the university on may 30 at which it demanded the authorities withdraw the police from the university and ensure a safety return home of more than 2,500 students who had not yet gone back home after participating in the ceremony.
The general student councils of Seoul National University, Sungsil University, Sungshin Women's University and three other universities staged a big student march urging a solution to the issue of the young unemployed at Youido, Seoul, on May 29.

   Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation of railways headed by Railways Minister Kim Yong Sam left here on May 31 to participate in the 27th ministerial meeting of the organization of railways cooperation to be held in Kazakhstan.

Unabated aerial espionage on DPRK
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. war hawks have perpetrated  more than 150 cases of aerial espionage on the North Korea in May by  mobilizing strategic   and tactical reconnaissance planes on different missions, a  military source said.  On the 31st, a U-2 high altitude strategic  reconnaissance plane flew over the area  along  the Military Demarcation Line to spy on our strategic objects.   On the 30th, a P-3 patrol  plane took off from a foreign base and made a long flight over the East Sea of Korea to spy on targets at the sea.   Cases of aerial espionage by strategic reconnaissance planes and patrol planes numbered  over 30 in May.

articles.content:
Sri Lankan committee to remember President Kim Il Sung formed
   Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Sri Lankan committee to remember President Kim Il Sung was formed on May 26 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the demise of the great leader Kim Il Sung.   The Minister of Vocational Education and Rural Industry and a vice-Minister of Port Development, Rehabilitation and Reconstruction were elected co-chairmen of the committee.   The committee decided to organize multifarious events including a seminar on the President's feats.

articles.title: Repeal of "NSL" in S. Korea demanded
S. Korean unionists meet to defend vital rights
articles.content:
Repeal of "NSL" in S. Korea demanded
   Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The South Korean chapter of the Amnesty International held a "campaign for human rights reform" in Seoul, South Korea, on May 30 and adopted a ten-point demand for the "government" authorities, according to the South Korean newspaper Choongang Ilbo.   The organization strongly demanded the "people's government" abolish the "National Security Law", release prisoners of conscience and the arrested union leaders and ensure women's rights.   It noted with deep concern that human rights violation is frequent in South Korea.

S. Korean unionists meet to defend vital rights 
   Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- More than 15,000 telecommunication unionists of South Korea held a rally for defending vital rights at Youido Park in Seoul on May 30 and demanded the authorities withdraw the layoff, according to a report.   The rallies said vital rights of telecommunication office employees are threatened by the authorities' layoff. They called for "totally withdrawing a plan for cutting down manpower" and paying the same salaries as before their reduction.   They warned they would wage a powerful anti-"government" struggle unless it meets their demands.
   The authorities rushed more than 5,400 strong police force of 45 companies to encircle the rally site.
